page.title: 12The Stud Farm
page.content: This farm is about 200 years old,but there are no deeds as they were destroyed in a fire at Rolleston Hall. The farm used to house the horses and carriages from the Hall. It is now a 60 acre dairy farm with a herd of 55 dairy cows,some hens,ducks and a goat.The only crop grown is grass for the cows and hay for the winter feed.There is quite a lot of machinery; 2 tractors,1 muck spreader,all hay- making equipment,a plough,harrows, chain harrows and two rollers. The buildings are the original ones with slight alterations.The cows are milked by pipe lines. There are many trees on the farm and all the boundaries between the fields are hedges,not barbed wire and fences. There are three spinneys with the farm and the trees and hedges must be hundreds of years old.
